video.title: TEDTalks: Cyber Awe
video.synopsis: Has social media made us more connected or ended intimacy? TED speakers stake out positions on the societal aspects of the Internet revolution.

episodes.synopsis: Clay Shirky shows how social media help citizens in repressive regimes to report on real news (however briefly).
episodes.title: Clay Shirky: How Social Media Can Make History

episodes.synopsis: Jonathan Harris's projects troll the Internet to make sense of the emotional world of the Web.
episodes.title: Jonathan Harris: The Web's Secret Stories

episodes.synopsis: In a funny, rapid-fire talk, Alexis Ohanian of Reddit tells the real-life fable of one humpback whale's rise to Web stardom.
episodes.title: Alexis Ohanian: How to Make a Splash in Social Media

episodes.synopsis: Seth Godin argues the Internet has ended mass marketing and revived a human social unit from the distant past: tribes.
episodes.title: Seth Godin on the Tribes We Lead

episodes.synopsis: A tech enthusiast discovers that technology's movement toward ubiquity and complexity is much like the evolution of life.
episodes.title: Kevin Kelly on How Technology Evolves

episodes.synopsis: A social theorist suggests that the Internet is made up of millions of disinterested acts of kindness, curiosity and trust.
episodes.title: Jonathan Zittrain: The Web as Random Acts of Kindness

episodes.synopsis: Who are the hackers? An underworld investigator profiles several convicted coders and reaches a startling conclusion.
episodes.title: Misha Glenny: Hire the Hackers!

episodes.synopsis: Clay Shirky looks at "cognitive surplus" -- the shared online work we do with our spare brain cycles.
episodes.title: Clay Shirkey: How Cognitive Surplus Will Change the World

episodes.synopsis: Twenty years ago, Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web. What's his next project?
episodes.title: Tim Berners-Lee on the Next Web

episodes.synopsis: Twitter co-founder Evan Williams reveals that many of the firm's successful ideas came from unexpected uses invented by the users themselves.
episodes.title: Evan Williams on Listening to Twitter Users

episodes.synopsis: How do we design the next phase of the Internet with accountability and freedom at its core, rather than control?
episodes.title: Rebecca MacKinnon: Let's Take Back the Internet!

episodes.synopsis: Ralph Langner explains how his team discovered the Stuxnet computer worm, a digital warhead, using cyber forensics.
episodes.title: Ralph Langner: Cracking Stuxnet, a 21st-Century Cyber Weapon

episodes.synopsis: Presenter Sherry Turkle studies how our devices and online personas are redefining human connection and communication as we know it.
episodes.title: Sherry Turkle: Connected, But Alone?

episodes.synopsis: In this talk from the TEDYouth conference, YouTube trends manager Kevin Allocca discusses the four reasons a video goes viral.
episodes.title: Kevin Allocca: Why Videos Go Viral

episodes.synopsis: Presenter Gary Kovacs makes the case that Web tracking isn't 100 percent evil; personal data can actually make your browsing more efficient.
episodes.title: Gary Kovacs: Tracking the Trackers

episodes.synopsis: At the TED offices, Clay Shirky delivers a call to defend our freedom to create, discuss and share, rather than passively consume.
episodes.title: Clay Shirky: Why SOPA is a Bad Idea

episodes.synopsis: Presenter Markham Nolan shares the investigative techniques he and his team use to verify images and videos in real-time on the Internet.
episodes.title: Markham Nolan: How to Separate Fact and Fiction Online
